Conditions

Class Negation

  • java.lang.Object
    • Conditions.Negation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Condition

    public class Negation
extends java.lang.Object
implements Condition
    A class of commands representing negations of commands. That is, a negation evaluates to true if its negated command evaluates to false.
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Brecht Gosselé & William Mauclet 2BiR: wtk-cws (Gosselé) en cws-elt(Mauclet)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Negation(Condition condition)
      Create a new negation, with the given condition as negated condition.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean evaluate(Robot robot)
      Evaluates the given negation.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this negation.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Negation

        public Negation(Condition condition)
        Create a new negation, with the given condition as negated condition.
        Parameters:
        condition - The negated condition of this new negation.

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public boolean evaluate(Robot robot)
        Evaluates the given negation.
        Specified by:
        evaluate in interface Condition
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot for which to evaluate the negated condition of this negation.
        Returns:
        A boolean true if the negated condition evaluates to false for the given robot, a boolean false is otherwise.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this negation.
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Condition
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string representation of this negation, namely the word "not", followed by the string representations of the negated command, and the whole enclosed by brackets.
